meanings.definition: To take a quick look or glance.
meanings.sent1: I will deek at the menu before deciding what to order.
meanings.sent2: She likes to deek out the window to see if the mail has arrived.
meanings.sent3: During hide and seek, he tried to deek around the corner without being seen.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to deek through the evidence to find the clue.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel would deek at the bird feeder before darting away.

meanings.sent1: He caught a deek of the mysterious figure before it disappeared into the fog.
meanings.sent2: She gave a quick deek at the clock to see how much time was left.
meanings.sent3: The child took a deek at the present before shaking it vigorously.
meanings.sent4: The deek of the shooting star left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The deek of the rare bird caused excitement among the birdwatchers.

meanings.sent1: The player managed to deek past the defenders and score a goal.
meanings.sent2: She had to deek around the obstacles to reach the finish line.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to deek out of taking a bath by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: He had to deek through the crowd to get to the front of the line.
meanings.sent5: The spy had to deek around the guards to enter the secret facility.
